When playing as survivor:
 "How was that a hit?"

When playing as killer:
 "How wasn't that a hit?"

An unfortunate 20 dollar experiment.  It might be worth a try for some, but it can be a very frustrating game at first.  I was a killer main to start out, and I had some successful matches with at least as many complete disasters.  The matching system seems to be fairly binary.  I generally would experience a match against survivor novices that I could get three or four kills against followed immediately after by a match against at least two Iridescent level 1 survivors that I could get no kills against (often only one or two hooks and many of those matches included a Twitch TV olympian).  Mind you this is with low double digit hours in game, which seems fairly broken to me but may be a nasty symptom of the fact that relatively fewer players are willing to play as a killer.

In terms of the fundamental game mechanics, I personally dislike the concept of hooks, generators, and pallets.  I know that sounds ridiculously absurd since all three are at the core of this game, but against an organized crew of survivors who can sabotage hooks at will, make offerings to go to terrible maps and spread the hooks far apart, the game was ultimately no fun at all for me at least half the time.

Certainly you could spend hundreds or thousands of hours to memorize the maps and train yourself to counter such things, but until that time expect to be steam rolled at least 50% of the time.  There may be some hope down the road if Behaviour is able to improve their match making algorithm.  If it's a matter of getting more killers to play then perhaps they need to create some very deep incentives to play as a killer instead of as a survivor.

Ultimately, if you have precious few gaming hours and want them to be fun most or all of the time, avoid this game.  However, if you're curious about the asymmetric 4v1 genre, it may be worth a try.  Just don't expect to be consistently good for very, very long time.

Dead by Daylight is an amazing game. It has all the elements that a horror game would need. There is an entity with spider-like legs, and they want humans. You choose a killer, hang your victims on hooks, and let the entity kill them off for you. As a killer, they have all your favorites. From Ghostface, to Michael Myers, to Freddy Krueger, Pinhead, Saw, and more. If you acquire a mori on the bloodweb, it gives the killer a chance to kill the survivors themselves. It can be called Cypress Memento Mori, Ivory Memento Mori, or Ebony Memento Mori. These allow killers to kill survivors with thier own weapon. Now when you're playing as a survivor, you must repair 5 generators in a gated off arena, to power the exit gate and escape, the obstacle is the killer. This game can actually get scary sometimes when killers pop out of nowhere, but I typically play as a killer.
For fans of classic horror...this is for you!

В кратце, игра не для нормальных, в основном там сидят одни тролли, игра способна закинуть Первый ранг к Максимальному, 1 ур к 50 ур, и в худшем случае 1 ранг это Маньяк, который играет против людей, с не писаным правилом  ком(ху)ъюнити: Нельзя тунелить, нельзя Кемпирить, СУКА ДОДИКИ ОДУМАЙТЕСЬ, МАН СВИНЬЯ ПОД ЭТО ВЫТОЧЕН ЧТО БЫ КЕМПЕРИТЬ, Ман Легион убит в 0, играть не возможно, постоянно возникает желание ливнуть(что я и делаю), читеров по пальцам не посчитаешь, за один день ловишь как минимум 3-ёх, а то и 4-рых.
Тем более получаешь постоянные угрозы в чате, да чат можно отключить, и доступ к стим странице, но мне в лом.... честно, я боюсь что игра к 2023, растеряет игроков вот из за таких еблантяев.

Good game, if you can endure the camping/tunneling from the killers. It's pretty addicting and will consume hours of your day. Physics can be better, visuals are okay, audio is on point, gameplay is great. This game is still being updated so kudos to the devs. They have to fix the game itself moreso than adding content however.

Like in every online game, it's full of toxicity. Players are mostly selfish, caring about their own fun and nothing else. Gen rushing or tunneling/camping to speedrun the game (when you should do the opposite since the more time you spend in a match the more points you make and the more chance you get to rank up). But well, you can't change people... just know that this community is toxic.

Concerning the game itself, it's an asymmetric one so balancing it isn't easy. Both survivors and killers have very strong perks. Every killer has a different gameplay while choosing a survivor is more like choosing a skin if you have other survivors' teachable perks. Also, characters have huge hitboxes that will make you yell "it didn't touch me!" every game and some bugs still need to be fixed.

If you like slasher movies like Scream, Halloween, Tex. Chain. Mass., Nightmare on ES... and video games like Resident Evil or SIlent Hill, you might enjoy it, especially since every killer has its own gameplay. Or if you like playing survivors in a team with your friends.

So yeah, all in all it could be improved, like by creating different mods for competitive and casual players, and other things concerning balance and stuff like that. Besides that it's an enjoyable game. Like always, people are the problem.

Have tons of hours playing this game & it really is one of my favorites. So why the Downvote? 

I have tried to come back and play this game several times (as killer and survivor side) and every time I get paired with red rank 1 players that stomp my side into oblivion. SBMM Skill based matchmaking update is the worst form of matchmaking I have personally ever seen in a game. Not even close. 

Despite how much I like this game, it is 100% unplayable for me. Not fun. A hyper sweat-fest. And it isn't because I'm just a bad player. Matchmaking was 1000x better before SBMM. Until they revert what they've done, I will not play this game. And I don't think others should either.
